Authors: Ranti K.S., Salim K., Yuliyono A.D., Girsang A.S.
Title: Clustering behavioral data for advertising purposes using K-prototypes algorithm
Source title: International Journal of Innovative Technology and Exploring Engineering
Affiliations: Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Ranti, K.S., Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Salim, K., Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Yuliyono, A.D., Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Girsang, A.S., Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Understanding the customer sentiment is very important when it comes to advertising. To appeal to their current and potential customers, a company must understand the market interests. Companies can segment their customers by using surveys and telemetry data to get to know the customer’s interests. One way of segmenting the customer is by grouping or clustering them according to their interests and behaviors. In this study, the k-prototypes clustering algorithm, which is an improved combination of k-means and k-modes algorithm, will be used to cluster a behavioral data that contains both numerical and categorical attribute, obtained from a survey conducted on teenagers into clusters of 4, 5, and 6. Each cluster will contain teenagers with certain behavior different from other clusters. And then by analyzing the results, advertisers will be able to define a profile that indicates their interests regarding the internet, social media and text messaging, effectively revealing the kind of ad that would be relatable for them. © BEIESP.
Author Keywords: Behavioral data; Cluster Analysis; Interest; K-Prototypes

Authors: Yuliyono A.D., Baehaki, Luqman D., Utama D.N., Wibowo A.
Title: Six Sigma Based Performance Measurement of Tax Return Processing Improvement (Case Study: Directorate General of Taxes for Republic of Indonesia)
Source title: IOP Conference Series: Materials Science and Engineering
Affiliations: Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program - Master of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Yuliyono, A.D., Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program - Master of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Baehaki, Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program - Master of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Luqman, D., Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program - Master of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Utama, D.N., Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program - Master of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Wibowo, A., Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program - Master of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Directorate General of Taxes for Republic of Indonesia has an internal unit named data processing centre (DPC) that has main duty to process paper tax return delivered from tax office. DPC practically implemented new tax return processing system to replace the old system, however the performance of the new system was not on a par with the old one, at the beginning. Then, DPC made several improvements to increase new system's performance. This study aims to measure the improvements made by DPC by using Six Sigma approach. The approach is functioned to assess data processing performance through DMAIC concept: i.e. define, measure, analyse, improve, and control. With the DMAIC concept, improvement exposes better result, the average value of six sigma significantly escalated by 0.97 to 2.56. © Published under licence by IOP Publishing Ltd.
Index Keywords: Data handling; Process engineering; Process monitoring; Risk management; Systems engineering; Taxation; Work simplification; Average values; Indonesia; Performance measurements; Processing performance; Processing systems; Six sigma approaches; System's performance; Tax returns; Six sigma

Title: Artificial bee colony-optimized LSTM for bitcoin price prediction
Source title: Advances in Science, Technology and Engineering Systems
Affiliations: Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Yuliyono, A.D., Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Girsang, A.S., Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: In recent years, deep learning has been widely used for time series prediction. Deep learning model that is most often used for time series prediction is LSTM. LSTM is widely used because of its excellence in remembering very long sequences. However, doing training on models that use LSTM requires a long time. Trying from one model to another model that use LSTM will take a very long time, thus a method is needed for optimizing hyperparameter to get a model with a small RMSE. This research proposed Artificial Bee Colony (ABC) as a method in optimizing hyperparameter for models that use LSTM. ABC is a metaheuristic method that mimics the behavior of bee colonies in foraging. Optimized hyperparameter in this research consisted of sliding window size, number of LSTM units, dropout rate, regularizer, regularizer rate, optimizer and learning rate. In this research the proposed method called as ABC-LSTM. Bitcoin prices historical data was used as the dataset for evaluating the prediction of the models. The best ABC-LSTM model resulted best RMSE of 189.61 compared to model that use LSTM without optimization resulted best RMSE of 236.17. This result showed that ABC-LSTM model outperformed models that use LSTM without optimization. © 2019 ASTES Publishers. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Artificial Bee Colony; Bitcoin; Deep Learning; Hyperparameter; Long Short Term Memory; TensorFlow
